intro: Scutellaria violacea var. subglabra, commonly known as purple beardtongue, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It features square, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are typically grayish-green in color. The plant produces showy, two-lipped flowers in shades of violet to purple, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils, making it a popular choice for native plant gardens. Its botanical characteristics make it an attractive and ecologically valuable addition to diverse habitats.
